comments.body: so for example why is this in accessor.py and not somewhere else ? e.g. like a shared string library? this is doing work but not directly related to the accessors.

See @TomAugspurger note in the top post: 

> Note that there are a few methods like cat, extract, and extractall that don't yet dispatch. I need to look into them a bit more, there implementation is a bit confusing.

If those require a more extensive refactor of the method itself to use the same mechanism as the other methods, then that might be better as a separate follow-up PRs

ok i understand and that is fine. but for the purposes of this PR it is very confusing to put essentially an implementation in the accessor.py, rather than in the concrete classes themselves. alt put them in a separete module for now.

> it is very confusing to put essentially an implementation in the accessor.py

I don't think this is confusing, as `extract` is a method of the accessor defined above in this file .. Note that before this PR *all* implementations were in the file where the accessor was defined.

Right.

The issue with `extract` specifically is that it operates on the Series rather than the Array. The dispatched functions are all dispatching to the array. I'm sure that we can eventually dispatch to the array by extracting the relevant pieces, but that would be a bit larger change. I've tried to keep the changes here as small as possible (despite the size of the diff) by just moving things and adding just the necessary new pieces.
ok fair enough, can you create an issue to separate these other methods (maybe with check boxes) & align witht he strutcure)
